properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind gusts near 90 km/h are expected early this evening in Paulatuk and Sachs Harbour. These extreme winds will diminish before midnight but strong gusty winds are forecast to continue into Monday evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T13:21:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-05T21:22:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0395789750.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour, Paulatuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Continued For The Red River Between Emerson And The Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Red River between Emerson and the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-04-06T12:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-04-05T12:05:08-05:00, 52B45271-8513-823A-F5CA-3866759AC5CB
Area: The Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A total of 15 to 20 cm of snow is expected over this region by Monday evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T19:43:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-06T03:44:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4142618526.2020
Area: Blanc-Sablon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system tracking through Saskatchewan will bring 10 or more centimetres of snow to the Prince Albert region Monday. Areas in the Martensville region including the City of Saskatoon are also likely to see 5 to 10 cm of wet snow Monday. The low pressure system will continue towards Manitoba during the day Monday and this snowfall warning may be extended eastward accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T20:28:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-06T04:29:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2488218066.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Patchy freezing rain is expected to end by midmorning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T17:03:10-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Significant snow is expected to begin before daybreak on Monday near Waskesiu and spread north and east towards La Ronge throughout the morning. Snow will gradually abate overnight Monday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T13:28:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-05T21:29:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3655555704.2020
Area: Hwy 165 between hwys 2 and 914 including Pinehouse Lake, Lac la Ronge Prov. Park including La Ronge, Candle Lake Prov. Park and Narrow Hills Prov. Park, Montreal Lake and Molanosa, Prince Albert Nat. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. A low in Montana is spreading an area of mixed precipitation including freezing rain to areas in southwestern Saskatchewan. The freezing rain may accumulate quickly before moving off but surfaces will remain a slippery hazard until temperatures warm above zero. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-06T20:36:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-06T08:14:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3778432223.2020
